definition: to provoke/to irritate/to vex/to stir up/to anger/to attract (troubles)/to cause (problems)

sentences.english: Your negative emotions aren’t there to annoy you or distract you.
sentences.chinese: 你的負面情緒不會惹惱你，或困擾你。

sentences.english: IT IS a fair bet that one of Barack Obama’s new-year’s resolutions was to rattle Wall Street.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬新年改革之一很有可能會惹惱華爾街。

sentences.english: The show ruffled feathers among Beijing's commissars.
sentences.chinese: 這檔節目惹惱了北京的高層。

sentences.english: He back and don't rap to me, I know that he is annoyed by my words.
sentences.chinese: 他背過身去不理我，我知道他肯定是被我的話惹惱了。

sentences.english: The ecumenical approach seemed to annoy some executives.
sentences.chinese: 這種普遍採取的做法似乎惹惱了一些決策者。

sentences.english: What about when people are trying to enrage you?
sentences.chinese: 那麼當別人試圖惹惱你時，你怎樣？

sentences.english: A noisy noise annoys an oyster.
He aggravates her just by looking at her.
sentences.chinese: 他只是看着她就把她惹惱了。

sentences.english: Keep them informative yet concise . People want information quickly, and withholding it only annoys them.
sentences.chinese: 人們希望迅速獲得信息，藏着掖着只會惹惱他們。

sentences.english: They get annoyed with language problems, and they don't seem willing to assist.
sentences.chinese: 語言問題惹惱他們，他們也似乎不願意提供協助。

sentences.english: He has upset a country who rightly are not remotely concerned about Great Britains views.
sentences.chinese: 再說，他惹惱了一個無視英國意見的國家。

sentences.english: Gerald was nettled by this implication of vulgar materialism.
sentences.chinese: 傑拉德被她話語中流露出的庸俗唯物主義惹惱了。

sentences.english: If someone irritates you, it is only your own response that is irritating you.
sentences.chinese: 如果有人惹惱你，那只是你自己的反應惹惱了你。

sentences.english: If someone irritates you, it is only your own response that is irritating you.
sentences.chinese: 如果有人惹惱你，那只是你自己的反應惹惱了你。

sentences.english: If there is something getting Auster's goat, it's American politics.
sentences.chinese: 如果說有什麼惹惱了奧斯特，那便是美國的政治。

definition: making a deer out to be a horse (idiom); deliberate misrepresentation
abbr. for 國家安全局|国家安全局[Guo2 jia1 An1 quan2 ju2]
man behind the mirror/puppet master/string puller
to nod one's head and bow (idiom); bowing and scraping/unctuous fawning
to use violence (against sb)/to strong-arm sb/to manhandle
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
